laboratory_examinations.findings: The appendix is dilated to 10 mm with hyperemic mucosa and significant surrounding inflammation. There is significant edema of the adjacent cecum, likely reactive. The wall of the appendix, particularly at the tip, is not well defined raising concern for perforation. A small amount of fluid is seen in the right paracolic gutter, and there is perhaps a small 11 x 13 mm extraluminal more defined peripherally enhancing collection adjacent to the base of the appendix. Remaining visualized loops of small and large bowel are unremarkable without evidence of obstruction.
